Name: Camila Montoya
Description:
Camila was shot twice by police officers while she was walking through the streets of the El Retiro neighborhood in the 15th district of Cali.

> Relatives of the victim say that she was going home when police officers asked Camila an “inspection”, which she resisted.
> 
> “Her friends told me that the officers grabbed her and amid the struggle a shot rang out.” stated Martha Cecilia Montoya, Camila’s mother. “My daughter used pepper spray to defend herself, and immediately one of the cops shot her again,” she said.
> 
> Reports indicate that the young trans woman was opposed to the police inspection “only because agents wanted to touch her”. (In South and Central America, these police acts are mostly a form of abuse directly linked to the trans population, where police elements provocatively touch sensitive body zones, this was the kind of “touch” she was denying.)

TvT project: El Tiempo & QHubo, 06.01.2016

https://planettransgender.com/trans-woman-camila-montoya-murdered-colombian-police/

https://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/CMS-16472386

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was shot at least 5 times. Her identity is unknown.

> A [trans woman] was executed with several shots on the shores of Lagoa do Mondubiand the body left on Rua São Lázaro. She did not carry any documents that would identify her. At least five shots hit the victim; three of them in the back of the neck. Investigates took this to indicate that this was a case of summary execution.

Name: H. M. Prieto Medina
Description:
The victim was found bloodied in her bed, brutally murdered with blows and stab wounds to the head.

> CANCUN, MX.- As a result of the theft of a cell phone, the State Judicial Police (PJE) arrested a murderer who was at large. This is Jorge Colorado Muñoz, who in January of this year murdered his sentimental partner in Playa del Carmen, identified as [deadname] Prieto Medina; as a result of which an arrest warrant which had already been issued against him for the crime of homicide.
>
> [deadname] Prieto Medina, 28 years old, originally from Mérida, Yucatán, was found at midnight that day, in the middle of a bloody scene, wrapped in a blanket on her bed inside a room located on Avenue 55 between streets 2 and 4 in the Ejidal neighborhood. She had been brutally murdered with blows and stabs in the head.
>
> The detainee confessed to a crime of passion, accepting that he had been a sentimental partner of the now deceased, whom he murdered out of jealousy.

TvT project: Quequi, 07.01.2016 & NotiCaribe, 28.02.2016

https://noticaribe.com.mx/2016/02/28/por-el-robo-de-un-celular-cae-un-ano-despues-asesino-de-un-travesti-en-playa-del-carmen/

Name: Melanie
Description:
Melanie died of severe brain trauma after being beaten by a man she had gone with to the Empire Hotel at 14 José Manuel Othón Street.

The following morning she had been found naked from the waist down, alone and unconscious in the hotel room. When paramedics arrived they were unable to revive her and she was pronounced dead at the scene.
 
TvT partner organisation Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans & El Grafico, 10.1.2016

Description:

Name: Flavia Andrade das Neves
Description:
Flávia was found dead in a home where she was working as a housekeeper. She had been shot.

> Flávia - "The Lady in Red" for she was always wearing a long red dress, was from Pernambuco being born in Jaboatão dos Guararapes-PE. She suffered from mental disorders and came to Barra de Santo Antonio, this welcoming land. [deadname] Andrade das Neves was her baptismal name, and she had it in her head that she was from São Paulo. Throughout her life she managed to have the Paulista sutaco. It was impossible to say that Flávia was not from São Paulo because of her expression when addressing a person.
>
> Flávia didn't much like to live in a house that many barrense offered to [trans women]. She always lived like a beggar, but relied on barrense aids and won the trust the trust and respect of many through her charisma. Painted with a lively lipstick and makeup that caught the attention of many, she had the sympathy of all Barrense when passing through the various streets of the city.
>
> We were sad when she left us yesterday morning (Tuesday) for our Heavenly Father - so early and so cruelly. Flavia was found dead in a house that had recently worked as a housekeeper and where she slept.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & Blog do Gygy, 13.01.2016

https://homofobiamata.wordpress.com/2016/01/13/flavia-facadas-al-maceio/

Name: Giovana Atanazio
Description:
Giovana was last seen entering a client's car. Her body was found three days later among the rocks on the river's shore.

> A body was found by fishermen on the banks of the river Forquilhas, in São José (SC), on Sunday morning. According to an identification made by the Santa Catarina Civil Police, it is Giovana Atanazio, a [trans woman] who had been missing for three days.
>
> According to a friend's statement made this Monday at the 1st San Jose Police Station, Giovana was last seen on Saturday night, at kilometer 207 of the BR-101 highway, when she got into a white Gol-driven vehicle. by a man.
>
> On Sunday, local fishermen found Giovana, half naked, on rocks near a bridge. However, it would not have been thrown from there, as there are no signs of injury to the body, strengthening the most likely drowning hypothesis. According to Manoel Galeno, the commissioner responsible for the case, the next step is to identify the Gol driver and confirm when Giovana was last seen (with the help of security cameras at a nearby market. pointed out by her friend).

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & G1, 19.01.2016

https://homofobiamata.wordpress.com/2016/01/17/giovana-atanazio-afogamento-1a-dp-sc-sao-jose/

According to witnesses last night Marcia Cabrita had been drinking the previous night. She also had a health problem she had been undergoing treatment for. Apparently there are no signs of violence.

In 2001 Márcia had founded a carnival group in the city.

Description:
Nathallya was found stabbed inside her car on Avenida Beira-Mar on the morning of Sunday 19th January. She died in hospital.

At the time she was killed had been living in Paris where she worked as a graphic designer, for two years. She had traveled to Capão da Canoa to spend her vacation there.

There are suspicions that her murder was motivated by jealousy.

Nathallya's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/nathallya.scheidt.5.

Name: Jasmine Sierra
Description:
Jasmine's body was found by police on 22nd January in an apartment on the 1000 block of Monterey Street.

Her body showed signs of trauma and foul play is suspected. Whether the police found the body in Sierra's home or a neighbour's house is not known.

Her friends said they had no idea she was killed until weeks later because her birth name was published in the media.
 
> With details scant about Sierra’s death, transgender advocates like Jeriann Guzman, the executive director of the Solano Serenity Center and Kelli Busey, editor-in-chief of Planet Transgender have sought to humanize Sierra and draw awareness about her death. The Solano Serenity Center was among the first to list Sierra on its website among trans homicide victims who must be remembered this year.
> 
> “Piecing together her life like a crossword puzzle we are learning a little about her,’” says Busey in her Planet Transgender report. "There’s a Tumblr post where the author postulates a police conspiracy to cover up her murder which local media conspicuously called ‘suspicious.'"
> 
> The Tumblr post to which Busey refers alleges mishandling of the investigation by local police. While the author of the post remains unnamed, the individual’s allegations were repeated at the same time as the Tumblr post went live by two other trans people on Facebook (in comments now marked private) by individuals who claim to be friends of Sierra. (The author of the Tumblr post has not responded to a query by press time.)
> 
> The accusations on Tumblr and Facebook have yet to be verified because, for over a month, advocates say that Bakersfield police have not responded to queries. Advocates also note that the police’s apparent refusal to clarify the circumstances of the alleged homicide have exacerbated the transgender community’s frustration and fomented rampant speculation. 

TvT project: Advocate & Planet Transgender, 04.03.2016

http://planettransgender.com/bakersfield-trans-womans-murder-unknown-due-to-deadname/

https://www.advocate.com/transgender/2016/3/05/advocates-search-answers-bakersfield-trans-womans-killing

https://www.kget.com/news/the-murder-of-a-transgender-woman-leaves-the-community-upset-after-she-was-misgendered/396169713

https://bakersfieldnow.com/news/local/bakersfield-police-investigating-suspicious-death

Name: Monica Loera
Description:
Monica was shot in front of her home by JonCasey Rowell, 30, on the night of 22nd January. She died in hospital.

In November 2017 Rowell was convicted of her murder and sentenced in 20 years in prison.

> Rowell confessed to shooting Loera at the start of the trial, but his lawyers argued it was an act of self-defense. He allegedly believed Loera robbed him after he responded to her ad on backpage.com and visited her at her North Austin home in the early hours of Jan. 22, 2016. He told the jury that she threatened him with a bat when he came back with a loaded gun in search of his wallet, which was later found in his jacket pocket. Instead of leaving, he shot her from a foot away and fled. As Payan told the jury during closing arguments, “When you point a loaded gun at someone and shoot it at close range that’s an intentional act.”
> 
> Later that day he drove back to Childress, Texas, where his then-wife and 10-day-old son were living while he was working in Georgetown. Over the weekend he Googled numerous things, aside from how to get away with murder, including legal defense, porn, and backpage – once again looking for trans sex workers. “If he was so scared that he needed to use deadly force,” Payan asked rhetorically. “Why is he back at it the next day?”

TvT project: Pink News & Dallas Voice, 30.01.2016

https://transgriot.blogspot.com/2017/11/joncasey-rowell-convicted-in-monica.html

Name: Bruna Souza
Description:
Bruna was approached by several young men on the evening of Saturday 23rd January. They led her to a darkened area next to a motel in Sector Pauzanes and then stabbed her several times. The perpetrators then fled the scene.

She died in hospital after been found wounded by her colleagues.

> A [trans woman], known [as a sex worker] on Pauzanes de Carvalho Avenue in Rio Verde, in the southwest region of Goiás, was brutally murdered by a group of unidentified men. The crime occurred late on Saturday, Jan. 23, near a motel in the neighborhood where the transvestite was often.
>
> According to police reports, young [deadname] de Menezes, known in LGBT as the [trans woman] Bruna Souza, 23, was at her point when she was approached by several individuals who took her to a dark place and stabbed her several times. After the crime, her killers fled without being identified.
>
> Shortly thereafter Bruna Souza was found wounded by other colleagues from the prostitution spot in the Pauzanes de Carvalho sector. The Fire Department was called in and provided relief to the victim who was referred to the Emergency Care Unit (UPA). Bruna could not resist the severity of her injuries and died.
>
> Friends of Bruna Souza are upset and angry with the crime. The [trans woman] Isadora said that her colleague Bruna had no enemies and would not be involved in any kind of problem or illegal activity. In Isadora's opinion, the crime is a retaliation against [trans women] who works in the Pauzanes de Carvalho sector.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & Instituto Conscientizar, 23.01.2016

https://homofobiamata.wordpress.com/2016/01/23/bruna-souza-23-anos-facadas-go-rio-verde/

https://institutoconscientizar.blogspot.com/2016/01/mais-uma-travesti-e-brutalmente.html

http://plantaojti.com.br/noticias/travesti-e-cruelmente-assassinado-setor-pauzanes-em-rio-verde-go/

https://institutoconscientizar.blogspot.com/2016/01/mais-uma-travesti-e-brutalmente.html

Name: Ketelen Alves
Description:
Ketelen was shot twice in the abdomen by a potential client who approached her in a car.

> Manaus -  A [trans woman] identified as [deadname] Alves, 23, better known as Ketelen, died with two gunshots at dawn on Saturday (23), in a prostitution spot next to the headquarters of the State Secretariat of Finance (Sefaz), south-central zone of Manaus. The information can be found in the investigation report of the Specialized Homicide and Kidnapping Police Station (DEHS).
>
> Ketelen was waiting for customers at the prostitution spot on Rua Franco de Sá, San Francisco, around 2:30 pm on Saturday, with at least two other [trans women] near her. A man in a black Fox car with an unidentified license plate stopped to ask two other [trans women] for information about what the cost of a program would be.
>
> The the unidentified man (who had a tattoo on one arm) then stopped the car near Ketelen and talked to [her]. After talking with Ketelen and without getting out of the vehicle, the man fired two shots into the victim's abdomen.
>
> DEHS suspects the man was searching for Ketelen and stopped to ask the other two [trans women] for information just to see the victim's face. [Trans women] near Ketelen told police that the victim had to waitfor about 30 minutes for the Mobile Emergency Response Service (Samu) to arrive. She died at the scene of the crime.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & Correio da Amazonia, 23.01.2016

https://homofobiamata.wordpress.com/2016/01/23/ketelen-23-anos-tiros-am-manaus/

Name: Dani Pereira
Location: São José do Vale do Rio Preto
Description:
Dani was shot once in the chest. She died on the way to the hospital.

> A [trans woman] was killed last Sunday (24), in the Jardim Paraíso neighborhood, in Rio Preto, interior of São Paulo. The victim was shot in the chest area and was rescued but died from her injuries.
> 
> According to the 'Gazeta de Rio Preto', the Military Police reported that the [trans woman], named [deadname] Santos Pereira, 20, was rescued by the fire brigade and sent to the Northern Emergency Unit (UPA), where died before arriving.
>
> The body of the girl was sent to the Legal Medical Institute (IML) where she will undergo necroscopic examinations and will be released to family members.
>
> In the police report, witnesses told the military police officers who attended the incident that the young man was a transvestite and was making a point at the corner of Avenida Domingos Falavina and Rua Paschoal de Crescenzo and, moments before the crime saw a silver vehicle near the victim.

TvT partner organisation Grupo Gay da Bahia & Gazeta de Rio Preto, 25.01.2016

Name: Paola Barraza
Description:
Paola answered her door and was fired upon five times: three times in the head and twice in the chest. She died at the scene as a result of her wounds. She was a member of the board of directors of Asociacion LGTB Arcoiris (LGTB Rainbow Association).

TvT project: AWID & Front Line Defenders, 29.01.2016

Name: Michelly Fernandes
Description:
Michelly was shot eight times while just a few meters from Macaé police station.

> A [trans woman] was murdered a few meters from Macaé police station in a barbaric crime in another act of gratuitous violence in the interior of the state. On the eve of a meeting with the military police command on public protection policies for the LGBT community, a [trans woman] named Michele was murdered at one of the city's most frequented [spots for trans sex workers], Verissimo de Mello Square.

Name: Fabiano Hilário
Description:
Fabiano's body was found in an isolated place known as a dumping ground for murder victims. He had been shot in the head.

> According to Renato Coelho, delegate of the 4th Civil Police Station, who is leading the case, a suspect has already been identified. Police work on the hypothesis of murder, which is theft followed by death. However, friends and family raise, in Facebook posts, the suspicion of transphobia. The young man, who had disappeared the day before, was wearing a black jacket, a white long-sleeved T-shirt, jeans, and black sneakers. F.'s body had the mark of a gunshot to the head.

His Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/fabiane.hilario.1.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & Globo Extra, 28.01.2016

Name: Dana
Description:
Dana was shot in the head on the morning of Thursday 26th January and her body abandoned in a trash dump.

TvT partner organisation Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans & News Oaxaca, 28.01.2016

http://oaxacadiaadia.com/2016/01/31/ejecutan-a-travesti/

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was one of several killed by a group of vigilantes.

> On the afternoon of last Sunday, January 31, military police found the body of a [trans woman] inside a shack on Rua Antonio Burlini. She was wearing shorts and a bra, was gagged with a cloth in her mouth and tied with electrical wires around her neck. According to police, the place is frequented by drug users.

Later police revealed that a group of vigilantes were killing victims in the South Zone of SP, and that six people were killed between December and January with wires around the neck.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil &  Noticias UOL, 04.21.2016
